website_summaries.verdict: We recommend adding this super-rich supplement to dry kibble as an occasional nutrition boost, not as a regular meal.
pros: Formula similar to a slow-cooked beef stew with vegetables
Works well as a dry food topper or by itself
Human-grade ingredients, no grains or fillers
cons: Individual portion sizes smaller than expected
Some dogs may prefer the chicken formula to beef

customer_reviews.title: Good For Your Pet and Quality Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: These pour overs come in several flavors, they are safe for your pet and help get them to eat their food. Mine is on a special diet, and this has helped the food be eaten. Ingredients are people quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love this stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Dogs really like this stuff. We’ve tried a couple different flavors. Seems to be made of good quality ingredients. The only downside is the packaging. These toppers are great when you are getting your dog adjusted to a new type of food or if you have to mix in some kind of medication that they don’t like.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Does have small chunks of verggies.
customer_reviews.text: Great for adding on top of food or for when my dogs tummy is upset.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany  gold

customer_reviews.title: Picky dog likes (not loves) this one
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes it, he does not love it. It is good enough to keep getting
customer_reviews.author: Rocklaw P.

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love this brand!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this box to a friend who had a dog with allergies. Their dog just loves the food. It's such a better quality than the plain old kibble that you buy en masse.
customer_reviews.author: honolulufamily

customer_reviews.title: Great! Dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these pour overs. I have since switched to homemade food but this was a good transition start.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley A

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my dogs food. He really perks up when it is added and seems to really love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: It smells great! It looks great! My dogs love it! Honest Kitchen has saved the day!
customer_reviews.author: SSG V

customer_reviews.title: Causes Explosive Diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: My dog loved it but it gave him explosive diarrhea. I’ve given my dog similar food toppers before from Petco and they have never given him diarrhea. DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes crazy for these food toppers. All natural ingredients and is really good for picky eaters
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Our Dog Loves The Taste
customer_reviews.text: We buy this brand for our rottie, who has a very weak stomach, and is a picky eater. We give her 1/2 a pkg. in Am and remaining 1/2 with her PM Food. She Loves It.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Three dogs turned this down like it was radioactive!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing purchase. I have a 55 lb beagle (yep) mix(!), an obvious food hound, and a 7 lb. Pom who is even more a foodie than her big sister and they literally RECOILED from this after I added it to their regular dinners. Then I gave it to a neighbor who's has a big male rescue pup, inhales everything and he RECOILED from it as well. Either it's a bad batch or this stuff is not at all tasty or appealing...sigh...what a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Chick

customer_reviews.title: Great product but inconvenient packaging.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a picky eater and she loves this bone broth! My only complaint is the container it comes in, like a small milk carton, but has to be opened with scissors. Bad design on the container, but a great product inside.
customer_reviews.author: Pianone

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Baby Snooks likes it and has a renewed interest in her kibble now. I only use about two tablespoons per meal and it works fine. That makes the order last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Xadian

customer_reviews.title: Magic potion for picky eater.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have given a paws up for this product! However, opening the box does not go smoothly. I end up cutting the carton open. Wish it just had a twist off cap (hint, hint). With that said, one of my two dogs is sooooo picky/fussy about eating. Since I started dribbling the Pour Overs over her food, she now eats her food rather than having a silent protest. (Protest consists of laying right in front of her bowl, refusing to eat, and looking over her shoulder staring me down.) Will definitely be back to order more once this batch is gone.
customer_reviews.author: LAM2lake

customer_reviews.title: Change the packaging
customer_reviews.text: Packaging poor. Once you open your new container you better use the whole Thing or else it will sit around and grow mold on it like mine. I suppose you could put it in a container but it’s thick and messy and it’s more convenient to just pour it out (doesn’t pour well either) and be done with it. They seemed to like it but it’s too bad about the poor design. Most of it became useless and thus a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: martinamw

customer_reviews.title: Great broth for pick eaters!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my dog when he stopped eating his dry food. Instead of adding chicken broth with high sodium we added this. He ate it up! We watered it down because it does come out thick, so each box lasted around 4-5 servings. We found out that he has some specific food allergies so we had to stop using it and change foods, but we loved this broth while we used it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Yes and no
customer_reviews.text: Makes my picky eating Havanese dog interested in his food, for which I am grateful. I only use a small amount each day, so it gets a bit clogged up over the course of a couple of days, then comes out in uncontrollable spurts. It would be much better with a screw top to stay fresh longer. Not sure whether I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: cbc

customer_reviews.title: Texture inconsistency
customer_reviews.text: I bought a case. Still have half the case. At least 3 boxes look like this. Normally looks like an appealing gravy, but this looks like freeze dried, rehydrated yuck. I don't know what happened or why. It looked like this upon opening so it wasn't me not storing correctly. The other boxes have so far been like the gravy I expected and my dogs really love the stuff. They barely nibble their kibble throughout the day until I put this on their food. I'm concerned about what happened to these boxes, are they safe and the $$ spent.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Uhl

customer_reviews.title: Turkey & Salmon best of the pours overs
customer_reviews.text: The turkey and salmon is the only flavor of the bone broth pour overs any of my three dogs will touch. If your dogs like the strong flavor and smell of broccoli, kale or spinach they will do fine with the other flavors. Also, some of the other flavors have potato in them.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Awful packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly difficult to get open without a mess. Really impossible to open without a mess. I used them to make frozen summer treats for my dog so it’s not a huge deal the whole process is a bit messy. Otherwise love the product and so does my dog! Wish it were easier to open.
customer_reviews.author: Alisia

customer_reviews.title: Dog Didn't Really Like It
customer_reviews.text: My dog had been getting tired of his normal Honest Kitchen dehydrated food, so I got this to add some variety and flavor, but it didn't help. He didn't hate it, but it didn't make him any more interested in his food. Maybe it just tastes like the dehydrated Honest Kitchen he'd already been getting. Either way, he wasn't impressed.
customer_reviews.author: SWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Dog Loved It
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6 year old Pit Bull/Basset Hound mix and I have been trying to find a good topper for his dry food, this was recommended to me by a good friend. I think it was a great buy, nice big chunks of meat and veggies in the stew, my dog loved it!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Dead_Cynic

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but our dogs like it!
customer_reviews.text: This works great when your dogs get a little bored with their food. Our dogs love the taste, just wish it was a little less expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Stuff Is Delicious !!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t get a chance to do my weekly grocery shopping and my cupboard was bare so I poured two boxes over some rice and It made the perfect meal.... I never thought dog food could taste so good.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie the Tuna

customer_reviews.title: Easy meal topper
customer_reviews.text: My Chihuahua loves having these pour overs on top of his other food. One carton lasts several days and is easy to use and store in the fridge once opened.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor good nutritional value
customer_reviews.text: My dog really really likes the flavor. I like it is limited ingredients and good nutritional value. I use it to mix his meds with. It makes it easier to get him to take his meds.
customer_reviews.author: Laurena J Vande Weerd

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love this!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this bone broth. Sometimes when you order something for your pet(s) you aren’t sure if they will like it. They like it so much I’m doing subscribe and save.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Thelen

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Found this when my dachshund had several teeth removed and needed softer food. She has a sensitive stomach to beef so we stick to the chicken and she absolutely loves it! The packaging is not the best but certainly not a deal-breaker. Mixong it with her dry food, we get 2-3 servings out of each box and our Mollie is one happy girl!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: good quality ingredients
customer_reviews.text: My seventeen year old dog loves this added to her food....she can't chew very well, but it does help moisten her food so it is easier for her to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Finally! My dog is eating her food again with this topper!
customer_reviews.text: Use it for topping & mixing in with my dog’s regular food. She looks forward to eating again!
customer_reviews.author: Iris Leith

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes all other flavors but this
customer_reviews.text: Its an odd shade of green which I did not expect for a beef broth. My dog hates it. I wonder if I got a bad batch
customer_reviews.author: Rocklaw P.

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them!
customer_reviews.text: They certainly cheer up when I put this on their kibble! Would recommend & rebuy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: wonderful at first....
customer_reviews.text: my dog loved it at fist... poured it over his regular kibble... then a few weeks later stopped eating all together i cannot feed this to my dog too bad i had high hopes for this product
customer_reviews.author: missbella27

customer_reviews.title: Not sure you should take a chance.
customer_reviews.text: My cats refused to eat it. It was not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Kurleytop

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but didn't help.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea but my three four legged children were not impressed by the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Frazier

customer_reviews.title: My Dog loves this
customer_reviews.text: Good item and quicker than some other sources that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E

customer_reviews.title: Good for pouring over dry dog food!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this stuff, and I feel better about giving it to them because of the ingredients. Adds to dry dog food!
customer_reviews.author: Laura M. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Miracle gravy!!
customer_reviews.text: Since surgery, our dog became a VERY fussy eater. The Pour Over was the ticket for him to eat again!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Ingalzo

customer_reviews.title: Our pup won't eat kibble without a pour over!
customer_reviews.text: These pour overs are so good that our pup (unfortunately) won't eat dry kibble at all unless we top with Honest Kitchen stew.
customer_reviews.author: @shoes_and_sashimi

customer_reviews.title: My cat is strange
customer_reviews.text: I've never seen my cat abhor something so much. He likes the chicken but really hates the beef.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Lee

customer_reviews.title: Delicious! Or so my dog thinks.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these! They’re perfect for disguising a medication that she doesn’t like taking.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza Gager

customer_reviews.title: The whippet could not tolerate this stuff at all!
customer_reviews.text: I fed my 8 year old whippet about a quarter of a cup of this “broth” with his dinner. He absolutely loved it, gobbled it right up. Within 3 hours I knew we were in trouble, he was sick all night long. He continued to have explosive diarrhea for the next day and a half. It really dehydrated him as he is not a big guy to start with. I would strongly urge caution when feeding this product - not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. Klaassen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Topper To Encourage Picky Eaters
customer_reviews.text: Let's face it, even top grade kibble loses its charm to a dog. They are carnivores. Sure they like pumpkin, sweet potato, or peanut butter. But what they really want is meat. This is a 12 pack of 5.5 ounce cartons. The maker suggests 2 servings per carton, but I get 3-4 out of a box, drizzling it over the kibble my 70 pound Golden puppy eats. The ingredient list is good: Beef bone broth, beef, carrots, butternut squash, tapioca, thyme and sage. It smells like what you'd expect, kind of like a beef stew sans potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: B. Colonna

customer_reviews.title: Well received
customer_reviews.text: These shelf-stable cartons are handy to keep in your pantry. They work well as a treat and to provide variety for adult dogs. The sauce also helps boost your pet’s fluid intake on hot or humid days, when it’s extra important to keep hydrated. While I didn’t taste this myself, it smelled pleasant. The official taster liked it so much that I had to reduce the amount used so she wouldn’t wolf down her food too quickly. The carton top refolds well so you can refrigerate leftovers.
customer_reviews.author: ck

customer_reviews.title: Makes our Finicky Eater Chihuahua Gobble Up Her Food
customer_reviews.text: Our Chihuahua is a finicky eater--to say the least. She will leave her food in her bowl sometimes for days. She isn't ill, but we worry about her getting sufficient nutrition. The solution was to use The Honest Kitchen Bone Broth Pour Overs. With this placed over her dry food, she gobbles it right up. Instead of ignoring her food, she will even beg for it. We especially like that this product meets even human safety standards. There are not many dog food companies that provide products that can meet FDA standards. We are very pleased by The Honest Kitchen Bone Broth Pour Overs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey N. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with the formulation
customer_reviews.text: Honest Kitchen Bone Broth Pour Overs are a good source of bone broth for dogs. I have used a couple of varieties for humans and for pets. This is superior compared to many pet formulations because of ingredients and also that it is human grade. I find it slightly funny that it looks and smells more appetizing than some formulations designed for humans. I recommend starting very slow because this is really rich and could cause stomach upset if your pet is not already used to bone broth. My pets really enjoy this and I like that it is giving them the extra nutrition needed. I am impressed with the formulation.
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda344

customer_reviews.title: Makes kibble much more tasty
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to increase the pup-appeal of plain kibble. It's a soup-like consistency and not just a gravy-like topping with a good ingredient list that excludes grains and fillers. It comes in a shelf-stable soft container (much like some soups) that's easy to open and pour without any mess. The container states it has 2 servings, but I usually stretch it to 3-4 servings. It's not difficult to fold back the top to keep things fresh in the refrigerator. It is a bit pricey for an ancillary food item, but it's a big hit with the pups and a big hit with me regarding ease of serving and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Comdet

customer_reviews.title: Great Meal Topper
customer_reviews.text: My dogs, and cats, for that matter, love this meal topper. I love to add some variety to their food and this hits the spot and is a nice addition to keep things from getting boring. My guys get a good quality food and this yummy gravy type food makes a great topper for them a few times a week to keep things interesting. There are good, quality ingredients. I usually just use one carton for all three dogs, but if the cats see it, they want a taste too!
customer_reviews.author: C. Irish

customer_reviews.title: 5/5 Delicious (according to my dog)
customer_reviews.text: My beagle will simply not eat her dry food anymore. We have to put something over it every time. She is 13 and definitely set in her ways. :) So we tried these with her and she devours her food! She loves these so much that I actually just reordered them today. The only downside is that we use each of these containers for maybe 2 days worth of pouring so you have a kinda gross box to put back into your fridge after every serving. But it's worth it for her!
customer_reviews.author: AshertopiA

customer_reviews.title: Soy and corn free. All 7 dogs really like the beef
customer_reviews.text: We've tried all the Pour Over flavors and the beef is the definite favorite for my dogs. It's an ugly, grey mess visually, but the dogs don't care. There's little pieces of meat and carrots mixed in that make this a stew. I like the ingredients because they are simple and there's none of the junk fillers or allergens added. None of my dogs have experienced any digestive system upset eating these mixed with their regular dry food. All 7 like the taste and texture.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs & Horses

customer_reviews.title: Our dog love it, we use 1/2 a carton per feeding.
customer_reviews.text: Our 50lb mixed breed dog loves these. We feed her dry food and often will mix in some wet cat food (we feed our cat at the same time) just to mix things up a bit. This seems like a nice treat for her and she enjoys them and perks up when she sees the small carton. These come in single serving cartons, although we use just 1/2 per serving of dry food. We don't do it every feeding and have a few different flavors to keep things interesting. Maybe it's just our impression of things, but we're happy with the product and the ingredients and such make it seem healthy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel's Buddy

customer_reviews.title: This bone broth will bring your dog eagerly to its bowl
customer_reviews.text: Our mini-mini schnauzer loves this stuff. But we don't give him too much at once--just a slight coating. So a box lasts several days for our little dog. We give him just a little bit for two reasons: We don't want his beard getting too mucked up. And, we notice that his stool is a little bit softer with this bone broth. Not too soft to pick up, but it definitely contains more moisture. (That might be a good thing.)
customer_reviews.author: I Do The Speed Limit

customer_reviews.title: Expense Is Only Downside
customer_reviews.text: I don't mind mixing whatever with my rescue dog's food if it will insure he eats his bowl at once. The reason I want him to finish is so our inside dogs will not scavenge it when we let them out. This stuff must be really good to a dog because Duncan, our rescue Beagle, starts barking and dancing when he sees me putting this on his bowl of food. Sure I'd rather just throw some dry food in the bowl, but Duncan rarely eats even half of his dry (He'll eat the rest over the day usually unless it gets scavenged) without this or similar on it.
customer_reviews.author: John Werner

customer_reviews.title: YUCK !!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the pet store(it was on sale; now I know why!!) Bailey took 1 whiff and my husband said honey come here and look at Bailey; She was with her nose trying to bury her placemat with the bowl of food on it. I HAVE NEVER SEEN HER DO ANYTHING LIKE THAT BEFORE. If that doesn't say Yuck ,I don't know what does. ( it didn't look very appetizing!!)
customer_reviews.author: Renae Skidmore

customer_reviews.title: Our pup loves this! Definitely a treat.
customer_reviews.text: We have a small (10 lb) dog. We added this to her food and she went crazy for it! She was very excited to have it on her food (which is dry) and ate it all in a matter of minutes, which is unusual for her. I feel like it's pretty rich for her. WE put about a third of a container on her food--I love the containers--they are great for closing up and putting them into the fridge. They kind of remind me of milk cartons at school. I don't know if I'd give this to her every day--like I said, it seems sort of rich, but she certainly loves it
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: The Honest Kitchen Bone Broth Pour Overs
customer_reviews.text: If you make your pup happy by adding a spoonful of your gravy or stew to their meal they will think they have died and gone to heaven when you pour a little of this bone broth over their meal. The broth looks very much like people food and has excellent human grade ingredients. My cat loves it too. I think this would be especially good for pets that aren’t eating as they should. I have a little trouble operating the box opening but maybe first you have to be smarter than the box.
customer_reviews.author: xkydivr

customer_reviews.title: Dogs' Favorite Flavor
customer_reviews.text: I have other flavors of this product, but I think the dogs prefer this one above all the rest. Of course, they don't get a lot of beef as we tend to buy them chicken and/or turkey dog food. So that may explain their preference for this flavor. I wish the carton were easier to open. And one of the dogs gets a bit gassy, but it's a real treat for them. I dole it out carefully. It says it has two servings in the carton, but you should be able to get much more out of it.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Salmon & Turkey Stew!
customer_reviews.text: This is a type of food that gets poured over regular dry dog food to make a special dinner. Each container claims it is enough for two servings, so one meal is a little cold since I place the pouches in the refrigerator after opening. While I couldn't get my grandmother's extremely picky eater to accept this, my own fur baby could not get enough. The kids complained about the fish smell in our kitchen, and the dog just wagged away.
customer_reviews.author: Redz

customer_reviews.title: Add to food
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are fed raw so they drink less water than kibble fed dogs. There was still a concern with my mini Pei getting enough water, so we've been adding some powdered doggy broth to her food. I am using these boxes now to add to all of my dog's food in the AM. This is more of a stew than a watery broth. Kibble fed dogs can never get enough moisture so I heavily recommend this product for them. The ingredients are good and the dogs like it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlemagne 🐇

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs LOVE this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: We have probably tried every flavor Honest Kitchen makes in the pour overs and our dogs love them ALL! We have three dogs and we just drizzle the pour overs on each of their bowls 2x/day. One carton lasts us for 3 three feedings because all we do is drizzle it and mix it in. Just enough to add extra flavor to their dry kibble. We use various Honest Kitchen products and have always had great results with them for our dogs!
customer_reviews.author: ~purplemoon~

customer_reviews.title: Well received
customer_reviews.text: This was a hit with the dogs. I have two pups. One will eat just about anything but the other is picky. They both devoured their morning meal when I supplemented it with this beef broth. The broth is more like a thick gravy and it mixes well with their dry dog food. I also add a bit of water to spread out the flavor. I don't have any complaints with the ingredients (what's not to like?) or the calorie count.
customer_reviews.author: JoeTAZ

customer_reviews.title: All the pets love Honest Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves The Honest Kitchen Bone Broth Pour Overs if he can get to the dish before the cat does. The cat loves almost anything that is meaty or fishy and wet. So, the substantial gravy component of this pour over works well for both of them. My only question is why is it so expensive? Human canned soups with similar consistency aren't usually this expensive. So, great quality but price is a very subjective thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Gentleheart

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these but..
customer_reviews.text: My dogs were so happy with these pour overs. Only thing is that it gives them diarrhea if they have a bit too much. One of our dogs had too much and when we got home, it was all over our bathroom. Make sure to give it in moderation. Good for older dogs who have a hard time eating.
customer_reviews.author: iminsomuchlove

customer_reviews.title: Picky eater loves it
customer_reviews.text: We have two Shelties. One eats anything in sight ravenously, and the other turns up her nose at dinner sometimes. The pour over perks her appetite up and she eats! One night I felt bad that the good eater didn't get the bonus pour over, so I put it on his food too. I turned my back for a moment and he had guzzled his whole meal and was stealing his sister's. I created a monster!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for a finicky pup!
customer_reviews.text: As my dogs are aging they seem to be losing the motivation to eat. This solves that problem! They can smell this as soon as I open a carton and are eager to eat. I use one carton and divide it between my 2 small dogs and 1 large dog. A little goes a long way! It doesn't take much to get them interested. I appreciate the natural and simple ingredients and the added nutrition for my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Buehl

customer_reviews.title: Interesting Container
customer_reviews.text: It took me a minute to look at and figure out how to get the container open. Once you know what you are doing it is easy and the best part is reclosable if you don't use it all. I hate the cans solely for this reason. Anyway, we split one between the two dogs and they LOVED it, we just poured some over the top of their dry food. It looks a little like puke, but they love that too lol
customer_reviews.author: brifinch89

customer_reviews.title: Looks Like Fresh Homemade Bone Broth Stew
customer_reviews.text: I am so tempted to taste some of this; it looks as good as my homemade stew for people! I love using bone broth as the base for my soups for added nutrition and the Honest Kitchen decided to bless our dogs with the same goodness. Both of my dogs enjoyed this and asked for more; they don't usually ask for more food after they clean their bowls but with this pour over they do!
customer_reviews.author: Darlaina Dancer

customer_reviews.title: My "Furry Grandson" Loves This Pricey Add-on ...
customer_reviews.text: "Honest Kitchen The Bone Broth Pour Overs" look terrible, smell okay, but my "furry grandson" loves it! Made of human grade products, this quality food add-on is fairly pricey - almost $2 per 5 1/2 oz. carton. I could not find the country-of-origin on the cartons or the product listing. This and the cost are the reasons I have downgraded this product to four stars.
customer_reviews.author: delicateflower152

customer_reviews.title: The Results of Pour Overs Are Empty Dishes
customer_reviews.text: The Honest Kitchen Bone Broth Pour Overs comes in 5.5 ounce boxes. Each box contains two daily servings. Poured over our dogs dried dog food results in empty dog food dishes. Both of our dogs love this. Even our cat wanted some - and that tells you right there that this is grain and potato free. 12 boxes last for 24 servings. My dogs love it!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela V

customer_reviews.title: Pour overs for the older dog
customer_reviews.text: Our 14 year old Australian Shepherd has started getting picky with her food. These pour overs add something to the smell or taste because if she decides she doesn't want to eat all we do is pour some of this on her food and she will lick her bowl clean.
customer_reviews.author: Alex P.

customer_reviews.title: Looks gross, dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: If you poured me a bowl of this, I would walk away. It looks gross. But, pour this over the dog’s kibble, and you would think they died and went to heaven! They love it. And, since it goes over their kibble, they eat every bite of the kibble. Two paws up!
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Great topper
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty cool. They're kind of sticky broths in wax containers that are easy to open and dump over our dog's kibble. Our dog doesn't like them *quite* as much as he does some more substantial toppers, but he does like them a lot. I like how easy they are to use, and that they encourage him to eat his dry food without soaking it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph91

customer_reviews.title: They love it...
customer_reviews.text: I use canned food occasionally but it can get pricey so mostly dry food is used around here. This is a great way to spruce that up occasionally as well. It must taste good because they love it both the young and the old. You get a lot for the price and one carton can stretch for two meals...and it's nutritious. We like it.
customer_reviews.author: K-cee Kit

customer_reviews.title: Smells good, looks delicious
customer_reviews.text: When I opened this, my stomach growled. It looks delicious and doesn't have that gross dog food smell. Both my dog and the cats love it. It also gets an A+ for container design. The box is easy to open without scissors or a knife, just pop up the tabs and tear off along the perforations. I will be putting this on autoship.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Happy Hound!
customer_reviews.text: My hound is not picky about food and has a rather healthy appetite. She likes most foods and this was no exception. The 5.5 box the broth comes in has 12 packets, 2 servings each. My dog just loved it!
customer_reviews.author: BeatleBangs1964

customer_reviews.title: Bowl licked clean
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is in charge of feeding our cocker spaniel. I asked my daughter how the kibble topper went over with the dog. She looked out side where the dog was eating and remarked that the bowl was licked clean. It can't get any better than that. Doggie knows what she likes and it shows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy addition to dry kibble
customer_reviews.text: My dogs also tried the pumpkin variety and liked it, but they seem to like this chicken flavor even more. They get it poured over their dry food. One carton is enough for my two dogs. It’s an easy way to add nutrients to your dog’s food without having to spoon it out like canned dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Divascribe

customer_reviews.title: Honestly, it's okay and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to all of my dogs. They like the taste, however, 3 of them are allergic to TAPIOCA with filler that is in this product. I will not be ordering this again.
customer_reviews.author: GJC

customer_reviews.title: The dogs loved it
customer_reviews.text: The dogs gobbled their food right up with this on top of it. It is easy to pour. This is definitely a treat for them since they normally just have plain old dry dog food. I used one carton to feed both dogs over their dry dog food no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Carina

customer_reviews.title: A bit more stewey than just broth, but good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This "broth" is a bit chunkier than what you would think of as broth, and is really closer to a stew, but doggo loves it nonetheless. I do like a true broth to make pupsicles for him. Luckily these still work for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Bukkene Bruse

customer_reviews.title: They will eat anything if I put this broth over it
customer_reviews.text: One of my dogs is a picky eater and if I pour this over her food she eats her food without hesitation. It's also good for them which makes it nice to add it to their food. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: FiFi's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Wholesome Nutrition
customer_reviews.text: Great ingredients from a great company and our Toy Pom loves it. What more could anyone ask for? Well, I guess a cap instead of having to cut the box would be better.
customer_reviews.author: CorpGovNet

customer_reviews.title: Like a thick stew
customer_reviews.text: The dog loves these over his dry food. It fools him a little into thinking hes getting some sort of people food. It looks like a thick stew with lots of nice chunks.
customer_reviews.author: MyPenName

customer_reviews.title: a winner
customer_reviews.text: this is our second order/flavor of these pour ons and the boys love them. great ingredients and the taste is obvioysly spot on based on their lapping it all up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: loves it
customer_reviews.text: My dog really loves this pour over and she finishes all of her dry food when I use this mixed in. This is such a great treat and good extra nutrition for her.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. ChaCha

customer_reviews.title: Great packaging, easy single use
customer_reviews.text: I get these as a gift for my super helpful sweet neighbor who has two dogs who are aging. These treats for their meals will be so special for her!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Zolar

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Like It
customer_reviews.text: I put just a couple large spoonfuls over their dry food. They really liked it & we had no stomach upset.
customer_reviews.author: Katawampas

customer_reviews.title: Wet down dog kibble
customer_reviews.text: This adds flavor and moisture to dog kibble and helps an older dog eat. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna D.

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to open at all but who cares. I use scissors. Dogs love it and I only use a little in each meal for flavor
customer_reviews.author: Mab7

product_meta.title: The Honest Kitchen Bone Broth POUR OVERS Wet Toppers for Dogs (12 pack), 5.5 oz - Chicken Stew
product_meta.description:
Pour Overs are healthy & Tasty pourable stews to boost to whatever is in your dogs bowl. With a wide variety of flavors, just a few ingredients, and an easy-to-use box, you can easily boost their bowl every day.

guaranteed analysis: Crude protein (min) 6%, Crude Fat (min) 0.5%, Crude Fiber (max) 1%, Moisture (max) 90% The Honest Kitchen Pour Overs are intended for intermittent or supplemental feeding only. This is a complementary food that should be fed along with a complete and balanced diet.
feature_bullets: SLOW COOKED STEWS: Pour these 100% natural, grain free toppers over your pup’s favorite meal to add a healthy boost of tasty nutrition to their everyday routine.
PROTEIN BOOST: Made with diced ranch raised beef and carrots in a savory bone broth, these chunky meal enhancers give an added boost of protein for dogs of all ages & breeds.

EASY TO USE: The BPA-free box conveniently holds 2 servings and can be easily opened, poured & closed back up, eliminating the need for any messy container transfers. Pour Overs will also stay pourable after opening and won't become hard or gelatinous like some dog food cans.

HUMAN GRADE: Introducing the world’s first, and ONLY, 100% human grade wet dog food topper! Pour Overs meet rigorous FDA human safety standards and use only ingredients approved for human consumption so there is no risk of anything questionable & unsafe in your dog's bowl.

NATURAL: This limited ingredient topper is made in human food facility with NO by-products, NO rendered meals, NO grains and potatoes, NO artificial colors or flavors, and only the highest quality, non-GMO whole foods.
